title: Citi Jordan Recognizes 22 Microentrepreneurs at 2013 Awards Ceremony
summary: Amman, Jordan - Citi and the Jordan River Foundation held an awards ceremony to recognize the achievements of 22 microentrepreneurs across the Kingdom.
tag-1: Citi Jordan Recognizes 22 Microentrepreneurs at 2013 Awards Ceremony
tag-3: Amman, Jordan – Citi and the Jordan River Foundation held an awards ceremony to recognize the achievements of 22 microentrepreneurs across the Kingdom.
tag-4: The Citi Micro Entrepreneur Awards, now in its eighth year, promotes entrepreneurship that brings positive community change in society. Winners from different sectors, including agriculture, trade, tourism and civil society institutions, were awarded cash prizes for their projects' socio-economic impact on community.
tag-5: Mr. Mayank Malik, Citi Country Officer of Jordan and Iraq, reiterated Citi's commitment to empowering local community members to promote and contribute to sustainable development in Jordan. "We are keen on sustaining this awards program here in the Kingdom as part of realizing this vision," Malik explained. "The Citi Micro Entrepreneur Awards has so far empowered over 300 entrepreneurs since its inception in 2005."
tag-6: "Citi has truly demonstrated its commitment to economic development and community empowerment in the Kingdom through the awards program," said Eng. Ghaleb Qudah, Jordan River Director General. "Capital invested in winning projects since the program's inception amounted to 808,000 JDs, with a market value of 1.766 million JDs, creating over 194 jobs across the Kingdom."
tag-7: The award is managed by the Jordan River Foundation; given its strategic role and expertise as a nongovernmental organization in empowering micro-entrepreneurs across the Kingdom, as well as ensuring transparency in Award management and nomination criteria.
